alert.note: Alert for Corson; Dewey (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued December 20 at 9:31PM MST until December 21 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST WEDNESDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM WEDNESDAY TO 11 AM MST SATURDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 55 below zero. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. For the Winter Storm Watch, blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations of one to two inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Corson and Dewey Counties. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, from 5 PM Wednesday to 11 AM MST Saturday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 5 PM MST Wednesday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Wednesday afternoon through Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Pre holiday travel late Wednesday through Friday will be impacted. Stranded motorists will face the threat of frostbite, hypothermia and even life threatening exposure.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Prepare for possible blizzard conditions. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
